entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is mentioned as a person who refused to speak of the sad business, and was known for his support of Muggle rights. He is described as brilliant and generous.

entities.name: albus
entities.description: Albus is mentioned as Dumbledore's son, who was initially assumed to be a Muggle-hater like his father. However, he is described as having no anti-Muggle tendencies and being a brilliant student.

entities.name: mug-16
entities.description: Mug-16 is mentioned as an organization that Dumbledore supported, which gained him many enemies in subsequent years.

relationships.description: Dumbledore is mentioned as Albus's father. This relationship is described as Dumbledore refusing to speak of the sad business, and Albus being initially assumed to be a Muggle-hater like his father.
Dumbledore is mentioned as supporting Mug-16, which gained him many enemies in subsequent years. This relationship is described as Dumbledore's support for Muggle rights.
